```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(graphics)
library(corrplot)
```

```{r}






cdi_data = read.csv("./data/cdi.csv") %>%
  janitor::clean_names() %>%
  mutate(crime_rate = crimes/pop)

cdi_cor = cdi_data %>%
  select(-id,-cty,-state) %>%
  cor() 

corrplot(cdi_cor)



  
```

```{r}


data = cdi_data %>% 
  select(crimes,crime_rate,pop18,docs,beds,poverty,totalinc)



groups <- cdi_data[, 17] 
# Plot correlation matrix
pairs(data,lower.panel = panel.smooth)


# Equivalent but using the plot function
plot(data) 
```
```{r}
x = cdi$pop18
y = cdi$crimes
plot(cdi$pop18, cdi$crimes, pch = 19, col = "lightblue")

# Regression line
abline(lm(y ~ x))

# Pearson correlation
text(paste("Correlation:", round(cor(x, y), 2)), x = 25, y = 95)
```
